text: hey guys I'm Lindsey strand and I don't
know about you but during the summer I
can't get enough strawberries well I
could probably eat an entire basket in
one sitting I think one of the best ways
to dress them up is in strawberry
shortcake so I've started with my
strawberries here I have two pints of
berries and I macerated these which
means you toss them in sugar I'm a
serrated them in a quarter cup of sugar
and a tablespoon of lemon juice and as
you can see as they've been sitting at
room temperature they've gotten nice and
juicy brings out all of the beautiful
flavors basically just let those sit for
an hour while you prepare the rest of
your dessert so for the short cakes I'm
gonna start with my dry ingredients this
is basically a biscuit dough so I'll
start with two cups of all-purpose flour
and then six tablespoons of granulated
sugar which is a quarter cup plus 2
tablespoons if you want to take a
shortcut a tablespoon of baking powder
[Music]
[Applause]
and 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt so I'm
just going to give this a quick mix with
my fork just to get the leavening
distributed evenly and to that I'm
adding 6 tablespoons of cold unsalted
butter cut into small pieces I'm gonna
do this with my fingers you could
definitely use a pastry cutter or a fork
or a couple of knives but I kind of like
to feel the sizes of butter that I have
so you're looking for about pea-sized
kind of flatten them a little bit
between my fingers and that helps make
really flaky biscuits when these go into
the oven the butter melts and that
creates an air pocket which creates all
those beautiful layers in your favorite
biscuits it's really warm in your
kitchen you can always pop this entire
mixture into the refrigerator to cool
down if your butter melts while you're
working on this or if it gets too
combined you're not gonna have a great
biscuit it'll get a little bit dense and
not the best texture I'm gonna leave it
a little bit chunky but not too many so
now I'm ready to add my heavy cream this
is one cup of cold heavy cream gives
that beautiful rich texture to the dough
and then you just want to barely mix
this with a fork just to dampen if you
over mix you're gonna end up with a
tough biscuit I can still see big pieces
of butter in there which is a good sign
all right so that's mixed a little bit

you could do this on a cutting board
that's what I do in my parents house
because they have a tiled counter and
you don't want to get dough stuffing all
the grout and you just turn this out so
I usually just give this a few Pat's but
you basically want to leave it still a
little bit shaggy
delicious Shortcake's to soak up all of

this into a square about six inches see
it's about an inch thick maybe a little
bit thinner three quarters of an inch
and here I have a two and a half inch

punch out four biscuits onto my

sticking just throw it in the bunch
flour and it'll make sure that the
butter and the dough doesn't stick and
I'm looking to get six out of this
recipe so I'm gonna take the scraps and
gently hold them together so just big
enough to make two more I'm ready to egg
wash the biscuits this will give them a
nice golden pop so here I have one large
egg and a tablespoon of heavy cream you
could definitely use water or maybe a
little bit of milk but I think this
gives it a really nice shiny top not
smooth so that you don't have little
bits of cooked egg that's not right
feeling
[Music]
just lightly brush this on top of the
biscuits so now these are ready for the
oven these are going into a 375-degree
oven for 25 minutes until they're nice
and golden brown
so I took my biscuits out of the oven as
you can see they are nice and golden
brown they have that lacquer finish from
the cream and the egg wash and I am
ready to eat but first I have to whip up

do this when you're ready to serve
because if you do it too far ahead your
cream will deflate so chilled bowl
chilled cream always helps in this

little bit of vanilla or maybe a little

adding a little bit of confectioner
sugar always helps sweeten up a bit and

all right the good part looks good so
